The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Dear Parents,
Below you will find very important dates to be well aware of!
Dates for your Diary
Please be aware of the following events happening before the end of term. More detailed information will be provided for each of these events in advance.
Tuesday 4th December: LC Music Recital
Wednesday 5th December: UC Music Recital
Tuesday 11th December: Y3 Production (am)
Wednesday 12th December: Y5 Production (am)
Y3 Production (pm)
Thursday 13th December: Y5 Production (pm)
Friday 14th December: FS and Primary Christmas Celebrations
Wednesday 19th December: Y6-9 Reports issued
Christmas Carol Concert (6 pm start)
Thursday 20th December: Secondary Christmas Celebrations
Friday 21st December: School ends 12 Noon.
Swimming Gala Year 1- 3
Just a reminder that the annual swimming gala for Years One, Two and Three will take place on Thursday 6th December from 9:30 until 12:45.
All Y1-3 students must arrive at school as normal and will travel to the gala with their class. All parents from those year groups are invited to attend and should go directly to the pool. A more detailed letter will go out regarding arrangements and the venue (only 5 minutes by car from school) to families on Monday.
We look forward to seeing you there!
Library Thursdays
Our school library on Upper and Lower Campus remains open every Thursday from 3:25- 4:25 offering the opportunity for parents to visit the library with their children.
This initiative has now been running for several weeks but unfortunately to this point with limited support. Please do use this opportunity to share and select books together if you can.
Poppy Appeal
The total raised in Moscow for the British Legion this year was £2000 exceeding all previous years by some margin. We are proud to have given over £300 from the school in support of that total.
We have today received special thanks from the Embassy for our contribution raised by the students, staff and families at ISM. Well done everyone!
Confirmed Academic Calendar for 2013/14
We are pleased to confirm the academic calendar for 2013-14 below.
As you will see the structure for the first two terms is identical to previous years.
Term Three has been the subject of much deliberation. However, we have concluded that a two-week break to incorporate Easter will be extremely beneficial for the majority of the community, particularly at the end of a long winter.
However, in order to accommodate that, we cannot observe a half term break in May. This decision was informed due to the fact that IGCSE examinations are being completed during this time, on which a break would have a significant negative impact.
We will continue to review this structure in practice ensuring that it is indeed the best arrangement. You can now go and make those exciting travel plans!
Academic Year 2013/14
Autumn Term (16 weeks)
Friday 16th August –SMT Meetings
Monday 19th – Friday 23rd August –Induction/INSET for all staff
Monday 26th August – Friday October 20th (8 weeks)
Monday 21st October – Friday 25th October Half Term Break
Monday 28th October- Friday 20th December (Noon finish) (8 weeks)
Spring Term (12 weeks)
Monday 13th January – Friday February 21st (6 weeks)
Monday 24th February – Friday 28th February Half Term Break
Monday 3rd March – Friday April 11th (Noon Finish) (6 weeks)
Summer Term (10 weeks)
Monday 28th April – Friday 4th July (Noon finish) (10 Weeks)
(Victory Day May 9th – School is closed on this day for the National Holiday)
